components.name: Fastlane Server
components.description: The central server that manages workflows, stores configuration, and orchestrates tasks across clients and external services. It handles authentication, authorization, and workflow execution.

components.name: iOS Client
components.description: A command-line tool that interacts with the Fastlane server to build, test, and deliver iOS apps. It utilizes Xcode and other iOS development tools.

components.name: Android Client
components.description: A command-line tool that interacts with the Fastlane server to build, test, and deliver Android apps. It utilizes Gradle and Android Studio.

components.name: Bitrise
components.description: A third-party service integrated with Fastlane for automated testing and build processes.  Fastlane interacts with Bitrise to execute tests and build artifacts.

data_flows.description: User interacts with the Fastlane web UI to define and manage workflows, specifying tasks, configurations, and credentials.
The server sends instructions and data to the iOS client to initiate build, test, and delivery processes.
The iOS client triggers automated tests within Bitrise based on workflow configuration.
Bitrise returns test results and build artifacts to the iOS client.

trust_boundaries.name: Web UI Trust Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The web UI represents a trust boundary where user input and configuration directly influence the execution of Fastlane workflows.  Potential for malicious configuration or injection attacks.

trust_boundaries.name: Client-Server Trust Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The interaction between the Fastlane server and its clients (iOS and Android) represents a trust boundary.  Ensuring secure communication and validation of data exchanged between these components is critical.
